snippet: Ransomware — when a virus freezes a user’s computer and criminals demand money to unlock it — has become a lucrative online scheme.
abstract: Ransomware--when a virus freezes a user’s computer and criminals demand money to unlock it--has become a lucrative online scheme; computer security experts say ploy makes more than $5 million a year; scourge originated in Eastern Europe in 2009 and has hit the United States, with some gangs working full time.
lead_paragraph: Ransomware — when a virus freezes a user’s computer and criminals demand money to unlock it — has become a lucrative online scheme.

headline.seo: Ransomware Is Expanding in the United States
headline.main: For PC Virus Victims, Pay or Else
headline.print_headline: For PC Virus Victims, Pay or Else
